result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce E Kirchhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery AMENDED FROM Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed
Consecutive to: Present sentence
Concurrent with: 15CF444, but consecutive to present sentence

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Stay out of all bars, taverns and liquor stores.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim V.W. (person, property, residence or family) direct/indirect or social media. Participate in Recovery program. No driving unless validly licensed. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

**AMENDED 7/2/2018:  To reflect defendant to have no-violent contact with victim V.W. with discretion by DOC agent.**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.  DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law but the surcharge is waived.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant's
Preliminary hearing on November 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, VW, (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Bruce E Kirchhoff in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Bruce E Kirchhoff in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
